mobs.long_desc: An ambitious mage walks the corridors of Kaaz searching for knowledge.
mobs.desc: An ambitious mage says "There is power in this temple and I will find it!" This mage seems older than most you would expect of his level. His lust for power has betrayed him and left him powerless and searching. His quest for power has misguided him from the true sight of what he seeks to attain.

mobs.long_desc: An ambitious priest walks the corridors of Kaaz searching for wisdom.
mobs.desc: An ambitious priest says "I don't care about my god! I want this power!" This cleric seems misguided by his lusts. He wants absolute power but has forgotten his true source of power. He has ignored such simple details as personal hygiene and cleanliness in his drive for power. This priest acts foolishly, searching for the source of an ancient legend.

mobs.long_desc: A tall thin creature lopes through the halls hissing at you.
mobs.desc: You see a black skinned thin creature with slightly glowing eyes. It seems to cling to the shadows of the passageway and isn't very social. Its skin is covered with boils and you find its hands in your pockets!

mobs.long_desc: A LARGE tall creature lopes through the halls hissing at you.
mobs.desc: You see a black skinned thin creature with slightly glowing eyes. It is quite a bit larger than the rest you have noticed. It seems to cling to the shadows of the passageway and isn't very social. Its skin is covered with boils and you find its hands in your pockets!

mobs.long_desc: Girbina Tickmaster sits here intently studying.

objects.ground: A statue of a priest raising a holy symbol dominates the room.
A statue of a sorcerer invoking destruction leers at you.
A pile of grey cloth lies here.

extras.text: A simple, non-descript grey cloth shirt.  The only noticeable part of the shirt is the symbol of an ancient clan embroidered on the chest.

objects.ground: A simple canvas cloak with an ancient symbol lies here.

extras.text: A heavy canvas cloak that can easily envelope you and protect you from the elements.  A large symbol of an ancient clan covers the center, marking its origin.

objects.short: a pair of grey canvas pants
objects.ground: Some grey canvas pants lie discarded here.

extras.text: These pants offer you basic protection from the elements.  They are lightweight and allow you freedom of movement.

objects.ground: A small red medallion on a necklace lies here.

extras.text: A magical token set into a leather band.  The symbol is of that of the Kaaz clan that disappeared at the end of the rift wars.

objects.short: a blue amulet of Kaaz knowledge
objects.ground: A small blue medallion on a necklace lies here.

extras.text: A shard of deep blue crystal encased in a leather binding.  It is slightly more powerful than it seems.

objects.ground: A small turban lies here almost hidden from sight.

extras.text: A weave of grey cloth set to protect your head.  The turban is tied together by a deep blue jewel surrounded by gold set in its center.

objects.ground: A belt of canvas lies here.

extras.text: A wide canvas belt with buttons along its borders is revealed to be a container.

objects.ground: An orb floats by you on its trip home.

extras.text: A sphere of pure crystal with a hint of blue color throughout.  It is warm to the touch and covered with odd runes depicting an ancient tale.

objects.ground: An orb floats by you on its journey home.

extras.text: A sphere of pure crystal with a hint of red color throughout.  It is warm to the touch and is covered with odd runes depicting an ancient tale.

objects.ground: A thin circle of copper resembles a coin.

extras.text: A thin copper wire bears the symbol of the Kaaz clan.

objects.ground: A small bracelet of copper lies here collecting dust.

extras.text: A band of copper is covered with runes depicting a tale of the magical battle of the Rift Wars...

objects.ground: An old pile of small bone rings lies heaped here.

extras.text: Gross!  This armor appears to me made of small circles of bone.  It seems rather protective though.

objects.ground: A small pile of metal circles is heaped here.

extras.text: A grey pile of steel circles lined with cloth that will easily cover your head.

objects.ground: A small fountain with clear water flowing from it stands here.

extras.text: A small stone fountain adorns the center of the hall.  A trio of small statues stands atop the fountain, one of a mage, one of a cleric and another of a warrior.

objects.ground: A small pile of bone rings lies folded here.

extras.text: These sleeves are made from roughly cut bone rings and seem to offer little if any protection.

objects.ground: A length of chain lies here.

extras.text: About thirty small bone rings are roughly connected together to form a piece of decoration.  It looks as though it may offer you a little protection though.

objects.ground: A few pieces of bone lie about.

extras.text: These are a few plates of bone that look as though you could fasten to your legs for a bit of protection.

objects.ground: A small bonehandled axe lies here in a bloody pool.

extras.text: This is a small light axe that is weakly constructed with iron and the bone of some creature.

objects.ground: A dull diadem lies here decaying in the corner.

extras.text: A thin cloth set with pieces of bone as decoration, it looks like it could be worn as a headband.

objects.ground: :P
A hunk of dark bread lies in the dirt.

extras.text: This very coarse bread is made of some kind of dark grain, with bits of the grain ground up in it.

objects.ground: A beaten-up tankard lies here.
A brown leather backpack lies off to the side.

extras.text: It is a frameless backpack made of thick, sturdy leather, double-sewn at all seams with waxed thread.

objects.ground: A ration of salted meat is being stored here.

extras.text: This slab of salted meat is wrapped in rough paper.  The salt appears to be only mildly succesful in keeping this meat from rotting.  A tinge of brownish-green can be seen within the meat.  Next time don't look at your food...just eat it.

triggers.name: Kaaz_semantic_fight1
triggers.commands: say You've got nothing for me! mosh %actor.name%

triggers.name: Kaaz_semantic_fight2
triggers.commands: say So you think you are mighty enough to take me?! laugh %actor.name%

triggers.name: Large_seether_death
triggers.commands: * Does next mob in spawn cycle already exist? if %get.mob_count[8031]% < 1 && (%actor.level% < 30 || %actor.quest_stage[dragon_slayer]% == 3) m_run_room_trig 36006 * Generate random room number to spawn drakes in. * Thanks to the evil Pergus for inspiring me to be * more evil. set rnd_range %random.126% eval rnd_room %rnd_range% + 8049 mat 16095 mload mob 8031 set rnd %random.100% mat 16095 mteleport ice %rnd_room% * Sometimes creatures don't get teleported out of the loading * room so we're gonna go back and purge it just in case. mat 16095 mpurge endif

triggers.name: wug_quest_seether_greet
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %get.mob_count[8031]% < 1 && %actor.level% < 30 wait 2 hiss %actor% say You can't have it!  You'll just break it! mecho %self.name% clutches a crystalline amulet to its chest! endif endif

triggers.name: genasi-sigh
triggers.commands: sigh say I don't really have time for this right now. c 'teleport' * Should only teleport to 23832-23869, other rooms are outside its range

triggers.name: wug_quest_load_draklings
triggers.commands: wait 2 wecho %get.mob_shortdesc[36004]% lets slip a crystalline amulet which shatters on impact! wecho %get.mob_shortdesc[36004]% groans, 'They will now be free of our prison...' wait 1s wecho All the seethers begin chittering! wait 1s wecho Off in the distance you hear the ROAR of a dragon of some kind! wecho It seems to be coming from the farmlands to the south of the temple.

triggers.name: test2
triggers.commands: wforce girbina say Yer mama wecho debug2

triggers.name: Girbina_Tickmaster_greet
triggers.commands: * * Greet trigger got Girbina Tickmaster * if (%actor.vnum% != -1 || %actor.level% > 99) halt endif if (%actor.class% == sorcerer) wait 2 * De-sluttify DG variable unset port_quest * * Conditionals for which quest is being done.  Note we're going * to require these be done in order. * if %actor.level% >= 25 && !%actor.has_completed[speculan_wilderland]% set port_quest SW say you will be on SW endif if %actor.level% >= 33 && (%actor.has_completed[speculan_wilderland]% && !%actor.has_completed[nikozian_ice]%) set port_quest NI say you will be on NI endif if %actor.level% >= 41 && (%actor.has_completed[nikozian_ice]% && !%actor.has_completed[stonewardens_promise]%) say you will be on SW set port_quest SW endif if %actor.level% >= 41 && (%actor.has_completed[stonewardens_promise]% && !%actor.has_completed[parcel_to_sw]%) set port_quest PtSW say you will be on PtSW endif if %actor.level% >= 49 && (%actor.has_completed[parcel_to_sw]% && !%actor.has_completed[winds_of_gothra]%) say you will be on WoG set port_quest WoG endif if %actor.level% >= 49 && (%actor.has_completed[winds_of_gothra]% && !%actor.has_completed[ruck_to_ni]% ) set port_quest RtNI say you will be on RtNI endif if %actor.level% >= 57 && (%actor.has_completed[ruck_to_ni]% && !%actor.has_completed[muster_of_sp]% ) say you will be on MoSP set port_quest MoSP endif if %actor.level% >= 65 && (%actor.has_completed[muster_of_sp]% && !%actor.has_completed[crush_the_wog]% ) set port_quest CtWoG say you will be on CtWoG endif if %actor.level% >= 73 && (%actor.has_completed[crush_the_wog]% && !%actor.has_completed[eldoria_proper]% ) say you will be on EP set port_quest EP endif if %actor.level% >= 81 && (%actor.has_completed[eldoria_proper]% && !%actor.has_completed[assembly_of_ep]% ) set port_quest AoEP say you will be on AoEP endif * Say IT if %port_quest% == SW say You are on SW endif if %port_quest% == NI say You are on NI endif if %port_quest% == SP say You are on SP endif if %port_quest% == PtSW say You are on PtSW endif if %port_quest% == WoG say You are on WoG endif if %port_quest% == RtNI say You are on RtNI endif if %port_quest% == MoSP say You are on MoSP endif if %port_quest% == CtWoG say You are on SW endif if %port_quest% == EP say You are on EP endif if %port_quest% == AoEP say You are on AoEP endif else halt endif

rooms.name: A Quiet Hallway
rooms.description: Only candlelight lights solemn dark, wooded corridors extending in all directions.  The walls are lined with tapestries depicting ancient battles among the races and the spoils thereof.  Statues of heroes of days past line the hallways in each direction.  A giant tapestry of the Book of Eternity dominates the north wall above the passage.

North.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

East.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

South.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

West.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

extras.text: A book set within a shimmering golden pyramid reflects the light in an array of colors. The book is infinite in length and etched on its cover is a symbol. The symbol gleams in the purest silver and seems to twist about itself.

rooms.name: A Quiet Hallway
rooms.description: Only candlelight lights solemn, dark wooded corridors extending in all directions.  The walls are lined with tapestries depicting ancient battles among the races and the spoils thereof.  Statues of heroes of days past line the hallways in each direction.  Two statues of note guard a doorway to the east.  The statues are of priests long since dead but edified here to guard the Sphere of Wisdom.

North.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

East.description: A doorway opens into a larger well lit room.

South.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

West.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

extras.text: A simple priest well armored for battle holds up a holy symbol as if in an empowered shout.

rooms.name: The Chamber of Wisdom
rooms.description: This room is well lit and you feel a sense of reverence as you look about. The tables here all seem to face a small stage at the back of the room.  Upon the stage is a lectern and a glass case housing a brilliant sphere of pure crystal.

West.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

extras.text: The statue is of Girr'Kaaz, an ancient priest who was destroyed by the vile Blackmourne in an act of jealous treachery.  Blackmourne's chosen one was installed into power long ago and is rumored to be an evil guildmaster to this day.  No one knows what became of the Kaaz lineage...
An ornate cabinet stands near the corner of the stage. It's closed by a simple glass door that shields an orb of pure crystal. The sphere glows slightly and you feel better in its presence.

rooms.name: A Quiet Hallway
rooms.description: Only candlelight lights solemn, dark wooded corridors extending in all directions.  The walls are lined with tapestries depicting ancient battles among the races and the spoils thereof.  Statues of heroes of days past line each of the hallways.

South.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

West.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

rooms.name: A Quiet Hallway
rooms.description: Only candlelight lights solemn, dark wooded corridors extending in all directions.  The walls are lined with tapestries depicting ancient battles among the races and the spoils thereof.  Statues of heroes of days past line the hallways in each direction.  The passage to the north is guarded by two statues on each side of an archway.  The statues are of fierce warriors engaged in combat.

North.description: The passage passes through an arch into a meeting room.

East.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

South.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

West.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

rooms.name: A Quiet Hallway
rooms.description: Only candlelight lights solemn, dark wooded corridors extending in all directions.  The walls are lined with tapestries depicting ancient battles among the races and the spoils thereof.  Statues of heroes of days past line each of the hallways.

East.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

South.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

Down.description: An iron ring is stuck into the wood of the floor.  It appears to be part of a trapdoor.

extras.text: The panel on the floor looks as though it would open if you pulled on it.

rooms.name: A Quiet Hallway
rooms.description: Only candlelite lights solemn, dark wooded corridors extending in all directions.  The walls are lined with tapestries depicting ancient battles among the races and the spoils thereof.  Statues of heroes of days past line the hallways in each direction.  Two statues of robed figures making arcane gestures guard the passage to the west.

North.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

East.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

South.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

West.description: The passage passes through an arch into a meeting room.

rooms.name: A Quiet Hallway
rooms.description: Only candlelight lights solemn, dark wooded corridors extending in all directions.  The walls are lined with tapestries depicting ancient battles among the races and the spoils thereof.  Statues of heroes of days past line each of the hallways.

North.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

East.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

rooms.name: A Quiet Hallway
rooms.description: Only candlelight lights solemn, dark wooded corridors extending in all directions.  The walls are lined with tapestries depicting ancient battles among the races and the spoils thereof.  Statues of heroes of days past line the hallways in each direction.  To the south is the exit of the temple.

North.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

East.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

West.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

rooms.name: A Quiet Hallway
rooms.description: Only candlelight lights solemn, dark wooded corridors extending in all directions.  The walls are lined with tapestries depicting ancient battles among the races and the spoils thereof.  Statues of heroes of days past line each of the hallways.

North.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

West.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

rooms.name: The Chamber of Thought
rooms.description: You stand in a dimly lit, partially spherical room.  The wall radiates a mystical power that makes the entire room glow strangely silver.  There are a few tables with mortar and pestle, different colored flasks, and scrolls laying about.  In the center of the room is a small cauldron with four carved wooden posts leaning over it converging in a pyramid.  Just in reach at the top of this cauldron is a glass case containing a glass sphere.

East.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

extras.text: The statue is of Ne'Kaaz the ancient arcane one. Brother in the Kaaz clan, he disappeared after Blackmourne's vile sin against the mortals. No one is sure of what ever happened to him. Rumors circulate that he is a god now or just wanders as a sage in the wilderness...
The cauldron boils slightly but seems cool to the touch. The posts of the pyramid are short and you can easily reach the glass case housing the glowing sphere within.

rooms.name: The Chamber of Strategy
rooms.description: You stand in a well lit room packed densely with tables and benches.  Maps of the entire realm cover the walls and you notice a throne of sorts at the head of the largest table.  Deep scars cover most of the furniture as if wild swordplay often takes place here.  The statue of a warrior is here.

South.description: The passage continues through the dim candlelight.

extras.text: The statue is of the sister of the Kaaz clan, Elia.  She is posed in a form of great rage, as though she were about to strike. Her face is sad though, at the loss of her brother Girr. Elia'Kaaz is also missing from the realms as is the entirety of the Kaaz clan. Those who are said to find and befriend them are rumored to gain powerful skills from their ancient knowledge.

rooms.name: A Dark Passage
rooms.description: Walking through this dark passage makes you shiver.  It's cold and wet and not kept up very well.  The wood lining the walls is decaying and covered with mold.  Dim torchlight barely lights the way.  The passage ends at a stairwell leading upward and ending at a trapdoor.  The trapdoor looks interesting.

East.description: The passage continues through the dim torchlight.

South.description: The passage continues through the dim torchlight.

Up.description: There is a stairwell along the wall leading upward, to a trapdoor.

extras.text: You look up and notice a trapdoor at the top of the stair with a simple ring to open it.

rooms.name: A Dark Passage
rooms.description: Walking through this dark passage makes you shiver.  It's cold and wet and not kept up very well.  The wood lining the walls is decaying and covered with mold.  Dim torchlight barely lights the way.

South.description: The passage continues through the dim torchlight.

West.description: The passage continues through the dim torchlight.

rooms.name: A Dark Passage
rooms.description: Walking through this dark passage makes you shiver.  It's cold and wet and not kept up very well.  The wood lining the walls is decaying and covered with mold.  Dim torchlight barely lights the way.

North.description: The passage continues through the dim torchlight.

East.description: The passage continues through the dim torchlight.

rooms.name: A Dark Passage
rooms.description: Walking through this dark passage makes you shiver.  It's cold and wet and not kept up very well.  The wood lining the walls is decaying and covered with mold.  Dim torchlight barely lights the way.

North.description: The passage continues through the dim torchlight.

West.description: The passage continues through the dim torchlight.

rooms.name: Dense Forest
rooms.description: A gently sloping hill behind the temple casts a view of the Mielikki town walls to the east.  Smoke from the inn's kitchen filters through the woods and smells quite good.  An ancient and weathered stone pathway has nearly been destroyed by the creep of vegitation.  The path extends southward into the temple and westward into denser trees and vegitation...

rooms.name: Dense Forest
rooms.description: The crest of a small hill just west of Mielikki in the dense woods surrounding the towns north west walls gives you the vantage of Sleepy Boulevard and some of Town Center.  The vegitation and trees are not so dense here due to a very smooth stone dais cut into the top of the hill.  The dais is weathered by the years and seems unremarkable.  There is a large bowl shaped hole hewn very smoothly into the center of the dais.  Several people could stand inside and walk out on each of the stairways exiting the hole in the north, east, south, and west.  The bases of broken obelisks oppose the stairways as though the local vegitation pulled them down over the years.

rooms.name: Worn Path
rooms.description: This pathway comes from the guard tower and runs eastward up a small hill coming off the steppe of the highlands.  The surrounding area is covered in the rich grass seen all over these plains and the wind blows, gently waving the tall grasses before you.

rooms.name: Highpoint Rest
rooms.description: The worn path from the tower climbs to this overlook which is a large dais with ornate benches well maintained for rest and outlook.  From here the grassy plains can be seen to descend from the steppe to the north Southward a magnificant city can be seen near the horizon.  A city of stone like no other in the realm.  The dais behind you well kept and free of vegitation by the Kerristone garrison.  It is made of a dark smooth stone and has a large hole hewn into it in the shape of a bowl.  There are steps exiting the bowl in each direction...

rooms.name: A Research Library
rooms.description: Above the first level of the mage guilds has been nearly hidden a cozy library of arcane knowledge.  Tables adorn the floors and a series of torches with a cold flame provide light.  The library extends south and east.

rooms.name: An Old Stone Ruin
rooms.description: A large smooth stone dais has been created here in the middle of the windswept plains of Gothra.  The dais is made of black and grey stone and is very wind and weather worn.  Some obelisks remain standing encircling the dais but most are broken.  There is a large bowl shaped hole hewn very smoothly into the center of the dais.  Several people could stand inside and walk out on each of the stairways exiting the hole in the cardinal directions.  There is a wind constantly blowing in from the west and the smell of sea salt is strong.  The blue of the western sea can be seen on the horizon as the plateau of the Gothra plains can be seen to fall off quickly into a forested foothills and sea plain.
